meanings.definition: The quality or state of being divisible into parts.
meanings.sent1: The partibilities of the cake made it easy to share with my friends.
meanings.sent2: I marveled at the partibilities of the jigsaw puzzle, each piece fitting perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat had such incredible partibilities that he could pull out endless scarves from it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a treasure trove of partibilities, each idea leading to a new discovery.
meanings.sent5: The partibilities of the rainbow made it a breathtaking sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The ability to be divided or separated into smaller parts.
meanings.sent1: The partibilities of the dough allowed me to make both cookies and a cake.
meanings.sent2: I was amazed by the partibilities of the fabric, how it could be cut and sewn into various shapes.
meanings.sent3: The toy robot had such amusing partibilities that it could transform into a car or a plane.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a depth of partibilities, each word carrying multiple meanings.
meanings.sent5: The partibilities of the river's flow created a mesmerizing pattern in the water.
